New Records: Nick Castellanos hit a walk-off RBI single to send the Phillies to a 7-6 win over the Mets in Game 2 of the NLDS, tying the series at 1-1
Key Match Events: Mark Vientos tied the game with a home run in the ninth inning
Bryson Stott's two-run triple against Edwin Diaz put the Mets in a 5-4 hole
Luis Severino allowed consecutive homers to Bryce Harper and Nick Castellanos in the sixth to tie the game
Post-Match Reflections: Brandon Nimmo said after the game, "Sometimes you are not going to win, but we threw some punches and I am very proud of these guys"
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a back-and-forth affair, with the Mets and Phillies trading leads throughout the night
The Mets' Edwin Diaz had a meltdown in the eighth inning, allowing a two-run triple to Bryson Stott
The Phillies' Nick Castellanos hit a walk-off RBI single to win the game
